page.title: 01THE AREA AROUND BEN HOGH
page.content: Ben Hogh is the highest hill on the island of Coll, at 339 feet. To the west lies the rocky and hilly coast with Hogh Bay and its long white sandy beach backed by tall sand dunes and Marram grass. To the north and east an area of usually wet boggy heather covered peatground with 2 small frashwater lochs and one cultivated field of hay in the south in the Machair area. there are 6 dwelling houses in this area, 4 of which are lived in. Also remains of old ruined stone buildings. The land is scarred from the past with the marks of lazybeds. This is farming country where sheep and cattle roam over the rough grazing. There is some dencing which seperates property boundaries, rather than dividing fields.
